verses.verse: Zorah, Aijalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and Benjamin, fortified cities.
And he fortified the strongholds, and put captains in them, and stores of food, oil, and wine.
Also in every city he put shields and spears, and made them very strong, having Judah and Benjamin on his side.
(Priests and Levites Move to Judah) And from all their territories the priests and the Levites who were in all Israel took their stand with him.

For the Levites left (Num. 35:2-5) their common-lands and their possessions and came to Judah and Jerusalem, for (1 Kin. 12:28-33; 2 Chr. 13:9) Jeroboam and his sons had rejected them from serving as priests to the LORD.
(1 Kin. 12:31; 13:33; 14:9; (Hos. 13:2)) Then he appointed for himself priests for the high places, for ((Lev. 17:7; 1 Cor. 10:20)) the demons, and (1 Kin. 12:28) the calf idols which he had made.

(2 Chr. 14:7) And after the Levites left, those from all the tribes of Israel, such as set their heart to seek the LORD God of Israel, (2 Chr. 15:9, 10; 30:11, 18) came to Jerusalem to sacrifice to the LORD God of their fathers.
So they (2 Chr. 12:1, 13) strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong for three years, because they walked in the way of David and Solomon for three years.
(The Family of Rehoboam) Then Rehoboam took for himself as wife Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David, and of Abihail the daughter of (1 Sam. 16:6) Eliah the son of Jesse.
And she bore him children: Jeush, Shamariah, and Zaham.
After her he took (2 Chr. 13:2) Maachah the granddaughter of (1 Kin. 15:2) Absalom; and she bore him (1 Kin. 14:31) Abijah, Attai, Ziza, and Shelomith.

Now Rehoboam loved Maachah the granddaughter of Absalom more than all his (Deut. 17:17) wives and his concubines; for he took eighteen wives and sixty concubines, and begot twenty-eight sons and sixty daughters.
And Rehoboam (Deut. 21:15-17) appointed (2 Chr. 13:1) Abijah the son of Maachah as chief, to be leader among his brothers; for he intended to make him king.

He dealt wisely, and dispersed some of his sons throughout all the territories of Judah and Benjamin, to every (2 Chr. 11:5) fortified city; and he gave them provisions in abundance. He also sought many wives for them.

(Egypt Attacks Judah) Now (2 Chr. 11:17) it came to pass, when Rehoboam had established the kingdom and had strengthened himself, that (1 Kin. 14:22-24) he forsook the law of the LORD, and all Israel along with him.
(1 Kin. 11:40; 14:25) And it happened in the fifth year of King Rehoboam that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had transgressed against the LORD,
